intro: Echium acutissimum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Echium acutissimum is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
